ghs_data.descriptive_name: Distillates (petroleum), solvent-refined heavy paraffinic; Distillates (petroleum), solvent-refined light naphthenic; Lubricating oils (petroleum), C15-30, hydrotreated neutral oil-based; Lubricating oils (petroleum), C20-50, hydrotreated neutral oil-based; Petroleum; Paraffin oils

flammable_liquids.rationale: Not classified because of its flash point: 149-232degC (NFPA, 13th, 2002)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 260 - 371 degC (NFPA (13th, 2002)), and exceeds 70 degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: SPECIES: Rat ENDPOINT: LD50 VALUE: > 5000 mg/kg REFERENCE SOURCE: IUCLID (2000)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat LD50 >5000mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Category 4 because of "SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LC50 = 2.18 mg/L." (IUCLID, 2000)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 based on several reports which observed mild irritation in rabbit tests (IUCLID (2000)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: By the test using a rabbit, there was a report (IUCLID (2000)) described to be mild irritation. So it was set as Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: [respiratory sensitization] No data. [Skin sensitization] In multiple tests(including the maximization test) based on OECD Guideline 406 using the guinea pigs, a result that none of them had the sensitization was obtained (IUCLID (2000)), and therefore it was put outside of the Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing genetic defects (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the increase in the abnormal cells in the cytogenetic study [chromosomal aberration test] (somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity test) using the rat (IUCLID (2000)), and based on the fact that increase was observed in frequency of the chromosomal aberration in the peripheral blood lymphocyte of the human who received occupational exposure (IARC suppl.7 (1987)), and on the fact that there being no information about the productive cell in vivo genotoxicity study. So we classified it as Category 2.

carcinogenicity.classification: Not classified(Highly refined oil), Category 1A(crude oil or slightly refined oil)
carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: May cause cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: Un-refined or slight processed oil is classified into group 1, and highly refined oil is into group 3 (IARC (1987)), and the proposal of ACGIH (2006) can also be said to be the almost same category. It is classified into the 1st group according to Occupational Health Society (1977) as un-refined and a half-refined article. As mentioned above, according to the classification of IARC which the classification has decided, highly refined oil is set to outside of category and unrefined oils or low grade treated oil to Category 1A.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is the statement that there is the grossly, histopathological acute changes (details unknown) in dependance to dose (1.51 - 5.05mg/L) in the rat test of inhalation exposure (IUCLID (2000)), it is classified into Category 3 (lung).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (lung, skin) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to as Category 1 (lungs, skin) since that pulmonary fibrosis, lipid pneumonias and lipogranuloma of lungs are reported in humans who received exposure of the mineral oils or the mist over many years (ACGIH (2001) and IARC 33 (1984),EHC 20 (1982)), and generation of the serious folliculitis is reported in the epidemiological study by occupational exposure to cutting oil (IARC 33 (1984)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 based on the reports that ingestion of mineral oil causes the aspiration into the lungs, and as a result it occures the pneumonie huileuses or chemical pneumonia in the human (EHC 20 (1982), IARC 33 (1984), ICSC (2001), ACGIH (2001)).
